data.title: Expose a transport's currently loaded passengers via the Lua API
data.body:
Use cases:
- Check if the transport has a required minimum number of passengers
- Check if a the transport contains a specific actor
- Modify the passengers' properties in subtle or not-so-subtle ways

data.title: Filename case inconsistencies
data.body:
Okay, so where to begin, right now OpenRA treats filename-cases quite serious sometimes.

Filenames of loose files under Windows are case-insensitive.
Filenames of loose files under Linux are case-sensitive.

Filenames of files inside MIXes will be case-insensitive in all OS. I didn't tested bag or big, but I assume them being the same as mix.

Consistency can only be achieved if the game starts to pretend to be fully case-insensitive at Linux but noidea if that worths it. Per asset hacks like the one suggested at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9483#issuecomment-144515789 are definitely not helping IMO.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27073197-filename-case-inconsistencies?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove redundant actor GADPSA from TS rules
data.body: I guess all the rebases caused #9124 to drop the GADPSA removal. With the MobileSensorArray using upgrades to deploy now, that actor has been made redundant and is currently unused YAML.

data.title: Remove bogus height check from Bullet explosion check
data.body:
Bullets have a fixed length anyway (unless they are blocked), so this copy-paste from the missile's check doesn't work as intended here.

Closes #9495.

data.title: Bullets explode too early
data.body:
Regression from #9174.

Will file a fix shortly.

data.title: Replay viewer and observer should enable selecting unit type by double clicking units
data.body:
This was possible with earlier releases, and seem to have got lost in later development. It was so nice to  double click units (especially key units, e.g. harvesters, aircrafts...) as an observer and quickly see the amount of them. Same thing with structures. I'm hoping this is something that can easily come back to us.

data.title: Fix incorrect "In progress" time shown in server browser
data.body: This fixes a couple problems. The in progress time should be using `TotalMinutes`, and we should be treating the local machine's current time as UTC to match the master server.

data.title: Cursor disappearing after changing video mode
data.body:
Release:
20150919 (Latest)

Reproduce:
1. Backup and remove your settings.yaml
2. Start OpenRA and load a mod (in my case, Red Alert)
3. Open settings, and change Mode from Pseudo-Fullscreen (default), to Fullscreen
4. Choose Restart Now (Restart Later seems to have the same effect)
5. No cursor, and restarting OpenRA again will not fix the issue

If you back out to the Mod screen, the cursor will reappear. If you then load a mod, the cursor will remain visible (temporary fix, at least until another OpenRA restart).

data.title: Map Music
data.body:
Load additional/replacement music from `map.yaml` with support for loading music from map assets.
Closes  #9472.

data.title: Mute units under fog
data.body:
Units not visible to the player should not emit sound.

Currently in TD, newly built stealth tanks make the cloaking sound, giving away the fact that the enemy built them. Also, stealth tanks already existing in a map audibly cloak at mission start.

Muting units would have the side effect that artillery fire may come out of nowhere though.

data.title: Scatter() sometimes fails to clear the actors from their current positions
data.body:
Often Scatter() is used in scripts to clear actors from a position. Unfortunately, the underlying Nudge() function does not quite insist on choosing a cell that is not the one where the unit is right now as the destination for the move. As a result, there is always a chance that an actor that was ordered to Scatter() stays where he is, which is probably not what was intended.

@pchote thinks it would be "easy" to add this. Me, i don't understand the relevant piece of code well enough to tell if that's the case.

data.title: Clean up assets
data.body: Fixes #9482.

data.title: Remove the rest of the unused installation assets
data.body: #9441 made a start, but there are a bunch of other assets that were left behind.

data.title: Creating a new unit SHP - alternative
data.body:
An alternative method to the other tutorials - https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Creation%20of%20a%20new%20unit%20for%20OpenRA%20(step%20by%20step) and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Converting-a-3D-infantry-model-to-sprites

I'm using three programs - 3dsMax 9, Bulk Rename Utility (http://www.bulkrenameutility.co.uk/Download.php) and SHP Builder (http://www.ppmsite.com/?go=shpbuilderinfo)

**3dsMax**: we make a model with a shadow plane and sunlight, eventually also spotlights from opposite sides, if some faces get too dark;
- for a usual tank, I'm using 32 cameras placed in a circle above the model clockwise; 63 from the infantry/sprite tutorial is a good angle (an example here - https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5zJIBBQb3EhQnhjczM0U0Zublk/view?usp=sharing)
- if you're not using TS-like voxel barrels, it's good to make them somewhat larger; they tend to lose pixels in conversion

**3dsMax rendering**: first, as the tutorials mention, you need to turn off anti-aliasing, namely under the Rendering/Render Scene/Renderer and Customize/Preferences/Rendering
- under Render Scene/Common Parameters I'm setting only the Output Size 420x420
- the actual rendering is made by the Rendering/Batch Render function: here we Add 32 entries (or as many cameras you made) and for every one we set an output file (for the sake of simplicity, the example uses from 1 to 32.png; 24bit RGB)
- if you're rendering an animated model, you have to set the output Range under Render Scene
- clicking Batch Render button then creates you 32 .png's
- it takes time, but a file with a preset Batch Render can be used as a template for other models
- if the unit has a turret, do two renders: one for the chassis, the other for the turret; just make sure you don't overwrite the first output

**Bulk Rename Utility**: let's open the program and drag and drop all the .png's we've made inside, sorting them by name
- under Remove we can chose the digits 0123456789; under Add/Prefix we choose the unit name; finally under Numbering we create a Suffix, starting at 0, Incr. 1, Pad 4 (important for SHP builder)
- then we select all the files and Rename

![bru](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13980246/10158028/6c2bcb9c-668f-11e5-8325-0af638955690.png)

**SHP Builder**: now we can make a single .shp file from the output pictures; open the program, choose File/Import and select the first frame (name0000.png)
- select the optimization; under Frame Size choose the desired frame size (e.g. infantry 50x39, mammoth tank 48x48), under Extra Settings choose Auto select background by pixel 0,0; then, click ok
- use the fifth tool icon Replace Color to select the correct colors for team and shadow; beware the dark shades receiving the background color (0 in RA palette)
- now we save it as SHP(TS) and put to our mod/bits

data.title: TFD System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException error
data.body:
Installing from the TFD CD on current release produces the below error if the .\Content\mod folder doesn't exist. Standard CD install handles this with a Directory.Create

```
An unhandled exception of type 'System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException' occurred in mscorlib.dll
Additional information: Could not find a part of the path     
'C:\Users\#UserName#\Documents\OpenRA\Content\ra\redalert.mix'.
```

data.title: Add "Install Content" support for C&C The Ultimate collection.
data.body:
C&C the ultimate collection looks to be windows only, and requires Origin, as it's a digital only collection.

would require identifying if the OS is windows, Origin is installed, and the game needed is installed.
Then Identifying the path of the installed game.
- registry path for windows xp: `HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\\EA Games\Command and Conquer Red Alert\Install Dir\`
- registry path for 64bit(OS) 7,8, and 10: `HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\EA Games\Command and Conquer Red Alert\Install Dir\`
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27016489-add-install-content-support-for-c-c-the-ultimate-collection?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: PNG file size reduction
data.body:
run pngcrush -brute on *.png

before:
- 70 File(s)      3.455.140 bytes

after:
- 70 File(s)      2.616.088 bytes

that's a 800kb size reduction that should translate almost identically to download file size

(edit: pngcrush is lossless)

data.title: Make the TS terrain depth data available for use by shaders.
data.body: This puts some initial groundwork in place for future prs that will implement depth sorting on the GPU.  The depth data embedded in the TS terrain sprites are loaded into the terrain sheet, and plumbing is adjusted so that it can be accessed from the sprite fragment shader.  As a demonstration / test case this also adds a new rendering mode to TS that renders the relative depth data instead of the regular colors.

data.title: TD mission yaml fixes
data.body:
- fixes #9466 (thanks @obrakmann!)
- removes Creeps faction from TD singleplayer missions (as pointed out by @obrakmann in  #9118)

data.title: Ensure that we have a working OpenGL context.
data.body: Essentially #9217, just with typos in the commit message fixed

data.title: Expose background music configration to Lua
data.body: This rounds out the functionality introduced by #8892. See also #9472.

data.title: Allow maps to define their own music
data.body: Right now maps like Fort Lonestar rely on definitions in the mod-shipped music.yaml for their ambient track.  It is a simple to change to add a Music: block to map.yaml.

data.title: Add a lua function to check for prerequisites
Invisibility issues
data.body:
I did a test game to try to show this properly.
[Here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/tw1w9bu7zkql5a4/OpenRA-2015-09-27T231419Z.orarep?dl=0) is a 5-minute-long replay. The version is commit 0e9257abcf39e2118b7b53df5c9f13fad429b828. The mod is TS.
- At first AI ignored my stealth generators. Then at some point just decided to get rid of them (admittedly I may have missed it building an unit with stealth detection).
- Notice how the titan doesn't stop firing at my soldiers when they restealth. Infantry around the titan don't, which may mean it has something to do with turret targeting.
